Install the Firefox Extension
To use Dispute Finder, you need to install the Dispute Finder Firefox Extension. Support for other browsers may come later.
Once you have installed the extension, Dispute Finder will look for known disputed phrases on the web pages that you browse and highlight them when it finds them.
If a page contains something you think is disputed and Dispute Finder isn't highlighting anything, then that probably means you need to either tell Dispute Finder that the claim is disputed or tell Dispute Finder about the paraphrase used on that page.
We recommend that you get started by searching the web for one of the claims that is already in our database. For example:
Global warming is a hoax
Torture works
Obama was not born in Hawaii
Eskimos have many words for snow
World Trade Center Building 7 was destroyed in a controlled collapse
You can also try searching for some of the hot claims or any of the other claims in our database.
